c74object.name: pdm.queue.manager

attribute.name: buffers
attribute.digest: Names of the queue and metadata buffers
attribute.description: Specifies the names of the two buffers used by the queue manager: - First argument: Name of the queue buffer that holds the data - Second argument: Name of the metadata buffer that holds read/write positions, loop lengths, and every values

method.name: write
method.digest: Write a value to the specified channel(s)
method.description: Writes a value to the specified channel in the queue buffer. If channel is 0, the value is written to all channels.

method.name: back
method.description: Moves the write position backward by the specified number of steps. If channel is 0, the position is moved for all channels. If steps is omitted, it defaults to 1.

method.name: looplen
method.digest: Set the loop length for the specified channel(s)
method.description: Sets the loop length for the specified channel. If channel is 0, the length is set for all channels. The length must be a positive number.

method.name: every
method.digest: Set the every value for the specified channel(s)
method.description: Sets the every value for the specified channel. If channel is 0, the value is set for all channels. The every value must be a positive number.

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump the current state of the queue buffer
method.description: Outputs a dictionary containing the state of all the queues, including buffer names, sizes, channel counts, and queue states.

c74object.description: Write to queues in a multichannel buffer, and set parameters for the queue reader.
